abstract: Editorial calls on international community to recommit to establishing  legitimacy and purpose of International Criminal Court; worries departures of several African nations and court's failure to bring Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad and Pres Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan to account for war crimes undermines its validity; urges Hillary Clinton to make good on her support of court as Sec of State by moving to have United States join tribunal if she is elected president.

headline.print_headline: A Stronger Court for War Crimes
headline.main: A Stronger Court for Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The international community cannot let the war crimes tribunal wither as African nations start to defect....
lead_paragraph: The international community cannot let the war crimes tribunal wither as African nations start to defect.
